application configuration properties
The role configuration properties of the application

properties.label: action.destructive_requires_name
properties.description: In order to enable allowing to delete indices via wildcards or _all, set this config to false.

properties.label: discovery.zen.no_master_block
properties.description: The discovery.zen.no_master_block settings controls what operations should be rejected when there is no active master.

properties.label: gateway.recover_after_time
properties.description: If the expected number of nodes is not achieved, the recovery process waits for the configured amount of time before trying to recover regardless. Defaults to 5m if one of the expected_nodes settings is configured.

properties.label: http.cors.enabled
properties.description: Enable or disable cross-origin resource sharing, i.e. whether a browser on another origin can execute requests against Elasticsearch.

properties.label: http.cors.allow-origin
properties.description: Which origins to allow.

properties.label: indices.fielddata.cache.size
properties.description: The max size of the field data cache.

properties.label: indices.memory.index_buffer_size
properties.description: Accepts either a percentage or a byte size value. It defaults to 10%, meaning that 10% of the total heap allocated to a node will be used as the indexing buffer size shared across all shards.

properties.label: indices.queries.cache.size
properties.description: Controls the memory size for the filter cache , defaults to 10%. Accepts either a percentage value, like 5%, or an exact value, like 512mb.

properties.label: indices.requests.cache.size
properties.description: The shard-level request cache module caches the local results on each shard. The cache is managed at the node level, and has a default maximum size of 1% of the heap.

properties.label: node.attr.data
properties.description: Custom attribute for ES node

properties.label: script.allowed_types
properties.description: Specify script.allowed_types in elasticsearch.yml

properties.label: script.allowed_contexts
properties.description: Specify script.allowed_contexts in elasticsearch.yml

properties.label: reindex.remote.whitelist
properties.description: Remote hosts for 'reindex' operation have to be explicitly whitelisted in elasticsearch.yaml using the reindex.remote.whitelist property. It can be set to a comma delimited list of allowed remote host and port combinations (e.g. otherhost:9200, another:9200, 127.0.10.*:9200, localhost:*)

properties.label: remote_ext_dict
properties.description: Specify the location of extensional dictionary from remote.

properties.label: remote_ext_stopwords
properties.description: Specify the location of extensional stopwords dictionary from remote.

properties.label: path.repo
properties.description: Specify the location of shared file system repository.

properties.label: repositories.url.allowed_urls
properties.description: Specify the location of read-only URL repository.

properties.label: es_additional_line1
properties.description: The additional configuration in elasticsearch.yml.

properties.label: es_additional_line2
properties.description: The additional configuration in elasticsearch.yml.

properties.label: es_additional_line3
properties.description: The additional configuration in elasticsearch.yml.

properties.label: logger.action.level
properties.description: The logger.action.level configuration in log4j2.properties.

properties.label: rootLogger.level
properties.description: The rootLogger.level configuration in log4j2.properties.

properties.label: logger.deprecation.level
properties.description: The logger.deprecation.level configuration in log4j2.properties.

properties.label: logger.index_search_slowlog_rolling.level
properties.description: The logger.index_search_slowlog_rolling.level configuration in log4j2.properties.

properties.label: logger.index_indexing_slowlog.level
properties.description: The logger.index_indexing_slowlog.level configuration in log4j2.properties.

properties.label: enable_heap_dump
properties.description: Whether to enable heap dump on out of memory error.

properties.label: heap_dump_path
properties.description: The path of heap dump.

properties.label: clean_logs_older_than_n_days
properties.description: Clean logs older than n days, n can be changed here.

properties.label: tcp_keepalive_intvl
properties.description: the interval between subsequent keepalive probes, regardless of what the connection has exchanged in the meantime

properties.label: tcp_keepalive_probes
properties.description: the number of unacknowledged probes to send before considering the connection dead and notifying the application layer

properties.label: tcp_keepalive_time
properties.description: the interval between the last data packet sent (simple ACKs are not considered data) and the first keepalive probe; after the connection is marked to need keepalive, this counter is not used any further
The role configuration properties of the application

properties.label: node.attr.data (#2)
properties.description: Custom attribute for ES node
The role configuration properties of the application

properties.label: node.attr.data (#3)
properties.description: Custom attribute for ES node
The role configuration properties of the application

properties.label: enable_elasticsearch_head
properties.description: Whether to enable elasticsearch-head.

properties.label: enable_elastichd
properties.description: Whether to enable ElasticHD.

properties.label: enable_cerebro
properties.description: Whether to enable Cerebro.

properties.label: enable_elasticsearch_hq
properties.description: Whether to enable elasticsearch-hq.

properties.label: enable_elasticsearch_sql
properties.description: Whether to enable elasticsearch-sql.

properties.label: ES Proxy Balance Policy
properties.description: Define the load balancing algorithm to be used in a backend

properties.label: ES Proxy Connect Timeout
properties.description: Sets the timeout for HAProxy to connect ES services, can be ms, s, m, or h, e.g. 50s for 50 seconds

properties.label: ES Proxy Timeout
properties.description: Sets the timeout for HAProxy to get response from ES services, can be ms, s, m, or h, e.g. 50s for 50 seconds

properties.label: ES Proxy Max Connections
properties.description: Sets the maximum per-process number of concurrent connections

properties.label: ES Proxy Max Request
properties.description: Sets the maximum allowed size of the client request body

properties.label: server.basePath
properties.description: Enables you to specify a path to mount Kibana at if you are running behind a proxy. Use the server.rewriteBasePath setting to tell Kibana if it should remove the basePath from requests it receives, and to prevent a deprecation warning at startup. This setting cannot end in a slash (/).

properties.label: server.rewriteBasePath
properties.description: Specifies whether Kibana should rewrite requests that are prefixed with server.basePath or require that they are rewritten by your reverse proxy
The role configuration properties of the application

properties.label: config.reload.automatic
properties.description: Periodically check if the configuration has changed and reload the pipeline. This can also be triggered manually through the SIGHUP signal

properties.label: config.reload.interval
properties.description: How often to check if the pipeline configuration has changed (in seconds)

properties.label: input_conf_content
properties.description: When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in input section

properties.label: filter_conf_content
properties.description: When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in filter section

properties.label: output_conf_content
properties.description: When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in output section

properties.label: output_es_content
properties.description: When you run logstash, you use the -f to specify your config file, and this config is what your config file contained in output elasticsearch section

properties.label: gemfile_append_content
properties.description: This config is used to adding content into Gemfile for logstash
custom services parameters

properties.label: ES Node IP
properties.description: The node IP of ES on which to dump JVM heap

properties.label: Operation Timeout
properties.description: The dump timeout in seconds

properties.label: ES Node IP
properties.description: The node IP of ES on which to clear dump JVM heap

properties.label: ES Node IP
properties.description: The node IP of ES on which to restart

properties.label: Operation Timeout
properties.description: The restart timeout in seconds
